p:
Nests were controlled for hatching date and chicks were weighed every second day. For each chick, we calculated the chick growth rate (g d −1) as the slope of the linear growth period
26 (4–14 days). Due to logistical constraints usually preventing measurements after August 10, we could not control all nests until fledging to measure fledging success (range of fledging age = 21–31 days
93 ).
